pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:0.5.eng: 43. The training rule on with a mouthful

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sakabaḷena mukhena byāharanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six spoke with food in their mouths. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.4.eng: One should not speak with food in one’s mouth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sakabaḷena mukhena byāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, speaks with food in his mouth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.9.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:0.5.eng: 44. The training rule on lifted balls of food

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū piṇḍukkhepakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate from lifted balls of food. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat from a lifted ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.3.1.comm: According to Sp 2.620 this means repeatedly lifting a mouthful. Since the following rule refers to breaking pieces off a ball of food, this rule may refer to biting repeatedly into the same ball of food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.4.eng: One should not eat from a lifted ball of food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca piṇḍukkhepakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats from a lifted ball of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.11.eng: if it is a fresh food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.11.comm: According to Sp 2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.12.eng: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.12.comm: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.15.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.16.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:0.5.eng: 45. The training rule on breaking up mouthfuls

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kabaḷāvacchedakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate breaking up mouthfuls. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat breaking up mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.3.1.comm: According to Sp 2.621 this means repeatedly breaking pieces off a ball of food. The word avacchedaka is further explained at Vin-vn-ṭ 1920 as chinditvā, “having broken off”. This, it seems, can only refer to breaking off pieces, not to biting. Each ball of food was a single mouthful, consisting of rice with suitable curry.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.4.eng: One should not eat breaking up mouthfuls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca kabaḷāvacchedakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats breaking up mouthfuls, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.11.eng: if it is a fresh food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.11.comm: According to Sp 2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.12.eng: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.12.comm: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.13.eng: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.13.comm: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.16.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.17.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:0.5.eng: 46. The training rule on stuffing the cheeks

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū avagaṇḍakārakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate stuffing their cheeks. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat stuffing my cheeks,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.4.eng: One should not eat stuffing one’s cheeks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā gaṇḍaṃ katvā bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats stuffing one or both cheeks, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.11.eng: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.11.comm: For phalāphale see PED, sv. ā⁴.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.15.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.5.eng: 47. The training rule on shaking the hand

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthaniddhunakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate shaking their hands. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.4.eng: One should not eat shaking one’s hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaniddhunakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats shaking his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.11.eng: if he shakes the hand to discard trash;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.15.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:0.5.eng: 48. The training rule on scattering rice

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sitthāvakārakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six scattered rice while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat scattering rice,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.4.eng: One should not scatter rice while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sitthāvakārakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats scattering rice, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.11.eng: if he discards rice while discarding trash;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk48:1.15.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:0.5.eng: 49. The training rule on sticking out the tongue

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jivhānicchārakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six ate sticking out their tongues. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.4.eng: One should not eat sticking out one’s tongue.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca jivhānicchārakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.9.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:0.4.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthampi pādampi kīḷāpentā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while walking in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will be well-restrained while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.4.eng: One should be well-restrained while walking in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaṃ vā pādaṃ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands or feet while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.13.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six made chomping sounds while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not make a chomping sound while eating,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.4.eng: One should not make a chomping sound while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca capucapukārakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a chomping sound while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.9.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:1.10.eng: The fifth subchapter on mouthfuls is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena brāhmaṇena saṅghassa payopānaṃ paṭiyattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.2.eng: a brahmin prepared a milk drink for the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.3.eng: The monks slurped while drinking the milk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.4.eng: A monk who was previously an entertainer made a joke of it, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.5.eng: “It’s as if the whole Sangha is cooled.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.5.comm: This is a play on words in the Pali. The Pali word here translated as “cooled”, sītīkata (literally, “made cool”), is similar to sītibhūta, “become cool”, an epithet for arahants, “perfected ones”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu saṅghaṃ ārabbha davaṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.7.eng: “How could a monk joke about the Sangha?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, saṅghaṃ ārabbha davaṃ akāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghaṃ ārabbha davaṃ karissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.11.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.14.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.15.pli: “na, bhikkhave, buddhaṃ vā dhammaṃ vā saṅghaṃ vā ārabbha davo kātabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.15.eng: “Monks, you should not joke about the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.16.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.17.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.17.eng: After rebuking that monk in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.19.1.eng: ‘“I will not slurp while eating,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.20.eng: One should not slurp while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.21.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca surusurukārakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.21.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, slurps while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.24.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.25.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:0.5.eng: 52. The training rule on licking the hands

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthanillehakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their hands while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not lick my hands while eating,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.4.eng: One should not lick one’s hands while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthanillehakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his hands while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:1.9.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:0.5.eng: 53. The training rule on licking the almsbowl

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pattanillehakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their bowls while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not lick my almsbowl while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.3.1.comm: According to Sp 2.628 “licking” includes using one’s finger: Ekaṅguliyāpi patto na nillehitabbo, “The bowl should not be ‘licked’ even with one finger.” It thus seems that the Pali word nillehaka is broader than “licking” in English.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.4.eng: One should not lick one’s bowl while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca pattanillehakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his bowl while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.11.pli: parittake sese ekato saṅkaḍḍhitvā nillehitvā bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.11.eng: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then licking it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.15.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:0.5.eng: 54. The training rule on licking the lips

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their lips while eating. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not lick my lips while eating,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.4.eng: One should not lick one’s lips while eating.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca oṭṭhanillehakaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his lips while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.9.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.
